newsitem.title: USA: Blue-chip stocks roar back; end sharply higher.
newsitem.headline: Blue-chip stocks roar back; end sharply higher.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks roared back from a deep sell-off to end on a strong note Tuesday, propelled by big gains in the shares of oil companies after U.S. military strikes on Iraqi targets lifted crude oil prices.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average ended up 32.18 points at 5,648.39 after being down more than 50 points early in the day. In the broader market, declining issues led advances 13-10 on trading of 335 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
